result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian R. Newby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

**Amended 9/9/16 to include DNA surcharge.

Defendant shall not have any marijuana, THC or like substances in his system.
Defendant shall not consume any alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this state unless authorized by the DMV and Agent.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not possess any substances illegally.
Defendant shall not possess any medications unless has prescription from physician.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where the sale of alcohol is the primary business.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he has reason to believe illegal substances or drug paraphernalia may be present.
Defendant to turn over current prescription for marijuana to Agent with 48 hours.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant granted good time credit.

Concurrent with: with 14CF148.
